entry.title: Serverless, what is it good for?
entry.summary:
Description

It's 2017 and 'serverless' is all the rage. What exactly is it and how can we use it? Will it save us money? Will it allow us to scale? When should we use it? How do we use it? In this talk I'll outline the who, what, when, where, why and how of serverless and when to use it to save money and time.

entry.title: Weather of The Century
entry.summary:
Description

The weather is everywhere and always. That makes for a lot of data. This talk will walk you through how you can use MongoDB to store and analyze worldwide weather data from the entire 20th century in a graphical application. You'll learn how to ask and answer questions about capacity planning and scaling for both real-time and ad-hoc operations when dealing with huge datasets.
